page.title: 16Ecology of Yewdale 2
page.content: The original deciduous{scrub}that covered the fells was removed by man many centuries ago. Fragments of the nearest equivalent now remain as {deciduous woodland}on the valley sides ( see{Local History}). The altitude, heavy rainfall, poor soil and topography make{grass}the only viable crop in our area, and so the open fell is covered by upland grasses together with{heather}and{bracken, whilst the valleys have enclosed rough grazing of better quality. In addition the factors mentioned encourage the growing of{conifers,}so that plantations have become increasingly common. These contrasting forms of vegetation provide suitable habitats for a wide variety of animals, as well as giving protection against{soil {erosion.
